CWEs: CWE-22: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
CWE-77: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
description: The function is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) as it takes a URL from the user and makes a request to it without any validation. This could allow an attacker to make requests to internal resources. The function is also vulnerable to Path Traversal as it uses user input to construct a file path without proper validation or sanitization. This could allow an attacker to access arbitrary files on the system. Finally, the function is vulnerable to Command Injection as it uses user input in a command that is executed without proper sanitization. This could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system.
